trait.name: Rapidly Regenerating
trait.text:
You heal quickly, both at will and in response to danger. As a bonus action, you can choose to spend one of your Hit Dice to recover hit points. Additionally, when you take damage, you can use your reaction and expend a Hit Die to regain hit points as long as the damage would not reduce your hit points to 0.
Source: Star Wars 5e v0.9.1 (Homebrew)

trait.name: Rugged Survivalist
trait.text: You are proficient in the Survival skill. Additionally, you are naturally adapted to hot climates, as described in chapter 5 of the Dungeon Master's Guide.

trait.name: Tech-Impaired
trait.text: While abyssin can figure out basic technology, they experience difficulty using more complex equipment like wristpads. You can not use tech powers or take levels in techcasting classes.

trait.name: Savage Attacks
trait.text: When you score a critical hit with a melee weapon attack, you can roll one of the weapon's damage dice one additional time and add it to the extra damage of the critical hit.

trait.name: Languages
trait.text: You can speak, read, and write Galactic Basic and Abyssin. Abyssin uses mainly growls and grunts that many species consider primitive. The written form of language uses only a small number of simple hieroglyphs.

trait.name: Physical Characteristics
trait.text: Height 5'7" +2d10" Weight 145 lb. x (2d4) lb.

trait.name: Proficiency
trait.text: You gain proficiency in one skill, one tool, and one weapon of your choice.

trait.name: Armored Plates
trait.text: You have thick armored plates. When you aren't wearing armor, your AC is 13 + your Dexterity modifier.

trait.name: Force Attunement
trait.text: Aing-tii have a natural attunement for the Force, which makes them resistant to its powers. You have advantage on saving throws against force powers.

trait.name: Force Sensitive
trait.text: You know the force push/pull at-will force power. Wisdom or Charisma (your choice) is your forcecasting ability for this power.

trait.name: Prehensile Tail
trait.text: You have supreme control over your tail and can use it to manipulate objects as well as your hands.

trait.name: Languages
trait.text: You can understand, read, and write Galactic Basic, and the non-verbal communication of the aing-tii. However, you cannot speak or make noise verbally.

trait.name: Bite
trait.text:
Your sharp teeth are a natural weapon, which you can use to make unarmed strikes. If you hit with it, you deal kinetic damage equal to 1d4 + your Strength modifier. Additionally, as a bonus action, you can perform a special bite attack. On a hit, the target suffers the attack's normal effects, you gain temporary hit points equal to your Constitution modifier (minimum of 1), and you can't use this trait again until you finish a short or long rest.
Source: Star Wars 5e v0.9.1 (Homebrew)

trait.name: Cosmopolitan
trait.text: You have proficiency in Lore.

trait.name: Nimble Escape
trait.text: You can take the Disengage or Hide action as a bonus action on each of its turns.

trait.name: Nimbleness
trait.text: You can move through the space of any creature that is of a size larger than yours.

trait.name: Racer's Reflexes
trait.text: Whenever you make a Dexterity ability check, attack roll, or saving throw, you can choose to add 1d4 to the result. You can choose to do this after the check is rolled, but before the DM determines if you've passed or failed the check. You cannot do so again until you complete a short or long rest.

trait.name: Undersized
trait.text: Your small stature makes it hard for you to wield bigger weapons. You cannot use heavy shields. Additionally, you cannot use martial weapons with the two-handed property unless it also has the light property, and if a martial weapon has the versatile property, you can only wield it in two hands.

trait.name: Languages
trait.text: You can speak, read, and write Galactic Basic and Aleena. Aleena is characterized by its use of short syllables and energetic movements to convey urgency and emotion.

trait.name: Ability Score Increase
trait.text:
Your Intelligence score increases by 2, and two other ability scores of your choice increase by 1.
Source: Star Wars 5e v0.9.1 (Homebrew)

trait.name: Crafter
trait.text: You have proficiency in one tool of your choice.

trait.name: Detail Oriented
trait.text: You are practiced at scouring for details. You have advantage on Intelligence (Investigation) checks that rely on sight within 5 feet.

trait.name: Pintsized
trait.text: Your tiny stature makes it hard for you to wield bigger weapons. You can't use medium or heavy shields. Additionally, you can't wield weapons with the two-handed or versatile property, and you can only wield one-handed weapons in two hands unless they have the light property.

trait.name: Puny
trait.text: Anzellans are too small to pack much of a punch. You have disadvantage on Strength saving throws, and when determining your bonus to attack and damage rolls for weapon attacks using Strength, you can't add more than +3.

trait.name: Small and Nimble
trait.text: You are too small and fast to effectively target. You have a +1 bonus to AC, and you have advantage on Dexterity saving throws.

trait.name: Tanned
trait.text: You are naturally adapted to hot climates, as described in chapter 5 of the Dungeon Master's Guide.

trait.name: Technician
trait.text: You are proficient in the Technology skill.

trait.name: Tinker
trait.text: You have proficiency with tinker's implements. You can use these and spend 1 hour and 100 cr worth of materials to construct a Tiny Device (AC 5, 1 hp). You can take the Use an Object action to have your device cause one of the following effects: create a small explosion, create a repeating loud noise for 1 minute, create smoke for 1 minute, create a soothing melody for 1 minute. You can maintain a number of these devices up to your proficiency bonus at once, and a device stops functioning after 24 hours away from you. You can dismantle the device to reclaim the materials used to create it.

trait.name: Languages
trait.text: You can speak, read, and write Galactic Basic and Anzellan. Anzellan is characterized by its bouncy sound and emphasis on alternating syllables.

trait.name: Physical Characteristics
trait.text:
Height 5'5" +2d10" Weight 140 lb. x (2d4) lb.
Source: Star Wars 5e v0.9.1 (Homebrew)

trait.name: Arms Dealers
trait.text: Whenever you make a Charisma (Persuasion) check related to buying or selling weapons, you are considered to have expertise in the Persuasion skill.

trait.name: Aggressive
trait.text: As a bonus action, you can move up to your speed toward an enemy of your choice that you can see or hear. You must end this move closer to the enemy than you started.

trait.name: Darkvision
trait.text: You have a keen eyesight, especially in the dark. You can see in dim light within 60 feet of you as if it were bright light, and in darkness as if it were dim light. You can't discern color in darkness, only shades of gray.

trait.name: Menacing
trait.text: You have proficiency in the Intimidation skill.

trait.name: Swim
trait.text: You have a swimming speed of 30 feet.

trait.name: Languages
trait.text: You can speak, read, and write Galactic Basic and Aqualish. Aqualish is a harsh, guttural language. It's rare that other species bother to learn it unless they regularly interact with Aqualish.

trait.name: Claws
trait.text:
Your sharp talons are natural weapons, which you can use to make unarmed strikes. If you hit with them, you deal kinetic damage equal to 1d4 + your Strength modifier.
Source: Star Wars 5e v0.9.1 (Homebrew)

trait.name: Clever
trait.text: You have proficiency in one Intelligence skill of your choice.

trait.name: Easily Addicted
trait.text: Arcona are susceptible to spice addiction, and as a result you are taught to identify it from an early age. Additionally, consuming salt can cause them to hallucinate, potentially replicating the effects of spice. Whenever you make an ability check related to identifying salt or spice or seeing whether something contains salt or spice, you have advantage.

trait.name: Hide
trait.text: You have a thick hide. When you aren't wearing armor, your AC is 13 + your Dexterity modifier. Additionally, your thick hide is naturally adapted to hot climates, as described in chapter 5 of the Dungeon Master's Guide.

trait.name: Keen Smell
trait.text: You have advantage on Wisdom (Perception) checks that involve smell.

trait.name: Reptilian Senses
trait.text: Whenever you make a Wisdom (Perception) check related to sensing heat, you are considered to have expertise in the Perception skill.

trait.name: Languages
trait.text: You can speak, read, and write Galactic Basic and Arconese. Arconese is spoken through complex, guttural squeaks from the back of the throat. However, arcona born and raised in colonies outside of Cona often did not learn Arconese, but the local language instead.

trait.name: Physical Characteristics
trait.text:
Height 3'2" +2d8" Weight 50 lb. x1 lb.
Source: Star Wars 5e v0.9.1 (Homebrew)

trait.name: Ability Score Increase
trait.text: Your Dexterity score increases by 2, and your Charisma score increases by 1.

trait.name: Darkvision
trait.text: You have a keen eyesight, especially in the dark. You can see in dim light within 60 feet of you as if it were bright light, and in darkness as if it were dim light. You can't discern color in darkness, only shades of gray.

trait.name: Four-Armed
trait.text: Ardennians have four arms which they can use independently of one another. You can only gain the benefit of items held by two of your arms at any given time, and once per round you can switch which arms you are benefiting from (no action required).

trait.name: Jungle Dweller
trait.text: Growing up in the tree-villages of Ardennia has left an impact. You don't treat jungle terrain as difficult terrain.

trait.name: Mask of the Wild
trait.text: You can attempt to hide even when you are only lightly obscured by foliage, heavy rain, falling snow, mist, and other natural phenomena.

trait.name: Prehensile Feet
trait.text: You have supreme control over your feet and can use them to manipulate objects as well as your hands.

trait.name: Strong-Legged
trait.text: When you make a long jump, you can cover a number of feet up to twice your Strength score. When you make a high jump, you can leap a number of feet up into the air equal to 3 + twice your Strength modifier.

trait.name: Treeclimber
trait.text: You have a climbing speed of 25 feet. You have advantage on Strength saving throws and Strength (Athletics) checks that involve climbing.

trait.name: Languages
trait.text: You can speak, read, and write Galactic Basic and Ardennian. Ardennian has a bubbly, energizing tone to it.

trait.name: Arkanian Brilliance
trait.text:
Whenever you make an Intelligence ability check, attack roll, or saving throw, you can choose to add 1d4 to the result. You can choose to do this after the check is rolled, but before the DM determines if you've passed or failed the check. You cannot do so again until you complete a short or long rest.
Source: Star Wars 5e v0.9.1 (Homebrew)

trait.name: Darkvision
trait.text: You have a keen eyesight, especially in the dark. You can see in dim light within 60 feet of you as if it were bright light, and in darkness as if it were dim light. You can't discern color in darkness, only shades of gray.

trait.name: Honed Mind
trait.text: You have advantage on Intelligence, Wisdom, and Charisma saving throws.

trait.name: Infrared Sight
trait.text: Whenever you make a Wisdom (Perception) check related to sight, you are considered to have expertise in the Perception skill.

trait.name: Sunlight Sensitivity
trait.text: You have disadvantage on attack rolls and on Wisdom (Perception) checks that rely on sight when you, the target of your attack, or whatever you are trying to perceive is in direct sunlight.

trait.name: Languages
trait.text: You can speak, read, and write Galactic Basic and Arkanian. Arkanian, when spoken, has an airy tone, and is regarded as one of the most difficult written languages to learn.

trait.name: Keen Hearing
trait.text:
Your antennapalps give you advantage on Wisdom (Perception) checks based on hearing.
Source: Star Wars 5e v0.9.1 (Homebrew)

trait.name: Snap Senses
trait.text: Through your antennapalps, you can sense incoming danger and react accordingly. When you roll for initiative, you can choose to gain advantage on the roll. Alternatively, if you are surprised, you may act normally on your first turn. Once you've used this trait, you can't use it again until you finish a short or long rest.

trait.name: Spicer
trait.text: You are proficient in spicer's kit.

trait.name: Toxin Resistance
trait.text: You have advantage on saving throws against poison, and you have resistance against poison damage (explained in chapter 9).

trait.name: Languages
trait.text: You can speak, read, and write Galactic Basic and Balosur. Balosur is known by its throaty rasps and deep vocalizations, and is considered crude as a written language.

trait.name: Physical Characteristics
trait.text:
Height 5'7" +2d10" Weight 140 lb. x (2d4) lb.
Source: Star Wars 5e v0.9.1 (Homebrew)

trait.name: Claws
trait.text: Barabel have retractable claws. You are proficient with your claws, which deal 1d4 kinetic damage on a hit.

trait.name: Darkvision
trait.text: You have a keen eyesight, especially in the dark. You can see in dim light within 60 feet of you as if it were bright light, and in darkness as if it were dim light. You can't discern color in darkness, only shades of gray.

trait.text: You are proficient in Survival.

trait.name: Prehensile Tail
trait.text: You have supreme control over your tail and can use it to manipulate objects as well as your hands.

trait.name: Languages
trait.text: You can speak, read, and write Galactic Basic and Barabel. The Barabel language is characterized by its barks and hisses.

Height 6'0" +2d12" Weight 175 lb. x (2d6) lb.
Source: Star Wars 5e v0.9.1 (Homebrew)

trait.name: Ability Score Increase
trait.text: Your Strength score increases by 2, and your Wisdom score increases by 1.

trait.name: Four-Armed

trait.name: Long-Limbed
trait.text: When you make a melee attack on your turn, your reach for it is 5 feet greater than normal.

trait.name: Powerful Build
trait.text: You count as one size larger when determining your carrying capacity and the weight you can push, drag, or lift.

trait.name: Languages
trait.text: You can speak, read, and write Galactic Basic and Besalisk.

Source: Star Wars 5e v0.9.1 (Homebrew)

trait.text: Your Intelligence score increases by 2, and your Dexterity score increases by 1.

trait.name: Detail Oriented
trait.text: You are practiced at scouring for details. You have advantage on Intelligence (Investigation) checks within 5 feet.

trait.name: Keen Hearing and Smell
trait.text: You have advantage on Wisdom (Perception) checks that involve hearing or smell.

trait.name: Musician
trait.text: You are proficient in one musical instrument of your choice.

trait.name: Programmer
trait.text: Whenever you make an Intelligence (Technology) check related to computers, you are considered to have expertise in the Technology skill.

trait.name: Languages
trait.text: You can speak, read, and write Galactic Basic, Bith, and one more language of your choice.

trait.name: Physical Characteristics
trait.text:
Height 4'3" +2d4" Weight 60 lb. x (2d4) lb..
Source: Star Wars 5e v0.9.1 (Homebrew)

trait.name: Ability Score Increase
trait.text: Your Intelligence score increases by 2, and your Dexterity score increases by 1.

trait.name: Naturally Stealthy
trait.text: You can attempt to hide even when you are obscured only by a creature that is your size or larger than you.

trait.name: Nimble Escape
trait.text: You can take the Disengage or Hide action as a bonus action on each of its turns.

trait.name: Shrewd
trait.text: You are proficient in the Insight and Deception skills.

trait.name: Languages
trait.text: You can speak, read, and write Galactic Basic and Bothese. Bothese had a great influence on the forming of Galactic Basic; the two languages share many cognates.

trait.name: Physical Characteristics
trait.text:
Height 4'9" +2d12" Weight 130 lb. x (2d4) lb.
Source: Star Wars 5e v0.9.1 (Homebrew)

trait.name: Ability Score Increase
trait.text: Your Dexterity score increases by 2, and your Charisma score increases by 1.

trait.name: Darkvision
trait.text: You have a cat's keen senses, especially in the dark. You can see in dim light within 60 feet of you as if it were bright light, and in darkness as if it were dim light. You can't discern color in darkness, only shades of gray.

trait.name: Leonin Agility
trait.text: Your reflexes and agility allow you to move with a burst of speed. When you move on your turn in combat, you can double your speed until the end of the tum. Once you use this trait, you can't use it again until you move 0 feet on one of your turns.

trait.name: Cat's Claws
trait.text: You have a climbing speed of 20 feet. Additionally, your unarmed strikes deal 1d4 kinetic damage. You can use your choice of your Strength or Dexterity modifier for the attack and damage rolls. You must use the same modifier for both rolls.

trait.name: Cat's Talent
trait.text: You have proficiency in the Perception and Stealth skills.

trait.name: Languages
trait.text: You can speak, read, and write Galactic Basic and Catharese.

trait.name: Physical Characteristics
trait.text:
Height 5'8" +2d8" Weight 120 lb. x (2d4) lb.
Source: Star Wars 5e v0.9.1 (Homebrew)

trait.name: Ability Score Increase
trait.text: Your Intelligence score increases by 2, and your Wisdom score increases by 1.

trait.name: Intuitive Initiative
trait.text: You can choose to reroll Initiative checks, but you must use the new roll.

trait.name: Keen Mind
trait.text: You have advantage on Wisdom saving throws.

trait.name: Perceptive
trait.text: You have proficiency in Perception.

trait.name: Strong-Legged
trait.text: When you make a long jump, you can cover a number of feet up to twice your Strength score. When you make a high jump, you can leap a number of feet up into the air equal to 3 + twice your Strength modifier.

trait.name: Trance
trait.text: Cereans don't need to sleep. Instead, they meditate deeply, remaining semiconscious, for 4 hours a day. While meditating, you can dream after a fashion; such dreams are actually mental exercises that have become reflexive through years of practice. After resting in this way, you gain the same benefit that a human does from 8 hours of sleep.

trait.name: Languages
trait.text: You can speak, read, and write Galactic Basic and Cerean.

Height 2'8" +2d8" Weight 35 lb. x1 lb.
Source: Star Wars 5e v0.9.1 (Homebrew)

trait.name: Keen Hearing and Smell
trait.text: You have advantage on Wisdom (Perception) checks that involve hearing or smell.

trait.name: Second Heart
trait.text: When you are reduced to 0 hit points but not killed outright, you can drop to 1 hit point instead. You can't use this feature again until you finish a long rest.

trait.name: Tinker
trait.text: You have proficiency with tinker's tools. You can use these and spend 1 hour and 100 cr worth of materials to construct a Tiny Device (AC 5, 1 hp). You can take the Use an Object action to have your device cause one of the following effects: create a small explosion, create a repeating loud noise for 1 minute, create smoke for 1 minute, emit an onerous smell for 1 minute.

trait.name: Trance
trait.text: Chadra-Fan only require 2 hours of sleep a day. After resting in this way, you gain the same benefit that a human does from 8 hours of sleep.

trait.name: Languages
trait.text: You can speak, read, and write Galactic Basic and Chadra-Fan. The Chadra-Fan language is characterized as being nasally and squeaky.

trait.name: Hide
trait.text: You have a thick hide. When you aren't wearing armor, your AC is 13 + your Dexterity modifier. Additionally, your thick hide is naturally adapted to both hot and cold climates, as described in chapter 5 of the Dungeon Master's Guide.

trait.text: Your skull is a natural weapon, which you can use to make unarmed strikes. If you hit with it, you deal 1d6 + your Strength modifier kinetic damage.

trait.text: You can speak, read, and write Galactic Basic and Chevin. The Chevin language is characterized by grunts and low-pitched rumblings. Chevin typically have deep voices, even when speaking Basic.

trait.name: Cultured
trait.text:
You have proficiency in the Lore skill.
Source: Star Wars 5e v0.9.1 (Homebrew)

trait.name: Equine Build
trait.text: You count as one size larger when determining your carrying capacity and the weight you can push or drag. Additionally, any climb that requires hands and feet is especially difficult for you because of your hooves. When you make such a climb, each foot of movement costs you 4 extra feet, instead of the normal 1 extra foot. Finally, a Medium or smaller creature can ride on your equine back if you allow it. In such a situation, you continue to act independently, not as a controlled mount.

trait.name: Hooves and Horns
trait.text: Your hooves (and depending on your age, horns) are natural weapons, which you can use to make unarmed strikes. If you hit with them, you deal kinetic damage equal to 1d6 + your Strength modifier.

trait.name: Powerful Charge
trait.text: If you move at least 10 feet in a straight line before hitting with a melee weapon attack, you can attempt to trip the target prone as part of the same attack. Once you use this trait, you can't use it again until you finish a short or long rest.

trait.name: Languages
trait.text: You can speak, read, and write Galactic Basic and Chironan. Chironan is characterized by its soft, melodic sounds.

trait.text:
Height 4'11" +2d10" Weight 110 lb. x (2d4) lb.

trait.name: Ability Score Increase
trait.text: Your Intelligence score increases by 2, and your Charisma score increases by 1.

trait.name: Tech Resistance
trait.text: Growing up around technology leaves an impact on chiss. You have advantage on saving throws against tech powers.

trait.name: Darkvision
trait.text: You have a keen eyesight, especially in the dark. You can see in dim light within 120 feet of you as if it were bright light, and in darkness as if it were dim light. You can't discern color in darkness, only shades of gray.

trait.name: Martial Proficiency
trait.text: You have proficiency with light and medium armor as well as the blaster pistol and sniper rifle.

trait.name: Languages
trait.text: You can speak, read, and write Galactic Basic and Cheunh. Cheunh is a complex language that is difficult for non-chiss to learn. Chiss take pride in this difficulty.

trait.name: Ability Score Increase
trait.text:
Your Charisma score increases by 2, and one other ability score of your choice increases by 1.
Source: Star Wars 5e v0.9.1 (Homebrew)

trait.name: Changeling Instincts
trait.text: You gain proficiency with two of the following skills of your choice: Deception, Intimidation, Insight, and Persuasion.

trait.name: Shapechanger
trait.text: As an action, you can change your appearance and your voice. You determine the specifics of the changes, including your coloration, hair length, and sex. You can also adjust your height and weight, but not so much that your size changes. You can make yourself appear as a member of another species, though none of your game statistics change. You can't duplicate the appearance of a creature you've never seen, and you must adopt a form that has the same basic arrangement of limbs that you have. Your clothing and equipment aren't changed by this trait. You stay in the new form until you use an action to revert to your true form or until you die.

trait.name: Unsettling Visage
trait.text: When a creature you can see makes an attack roll against you, you can use your reaction to impose disadvantage on the roll. You must use this feature before knowing whether the attack hits or misses. Using this trait reveals your shapeshifting nature to any creature within 30 feet that can see you. Once you use this trait, you can't use it again until you finish a short or long rest.

trait.name: Languages
trait.text: You can speak, read, and write Galactic Basic, Clawdite, and one more language of your choice. Clawdite is characterized by its rolling sounds paired with hissing sibilants.

trait.name: Four-Armed

trait.name: Hide
trait.text: You have a thick hide. When you aren't wearing armor, your AC is 12 + your Dexterity modifier.

trait.name: Keen Hearing

trait.name: Natural Grappler

trait.name: Trance

trait.name: Ability Score Increase

Your Intelligence score increases by 2, and your Strength or Constitution score increases by 1.
Source: Star Wars 5e v0.9.1 (Homebrew)

trait.name: Acute Senses
trait.text: You have proficiency in the Perception skill.

trait.name: Cannibalize
trait.text: If you spend at least 1 minute devouring the corpse of a beast or humanoid, you gain temporary hit points equal to your Constitution modifier (minimum of one). Once you've used this feature, you must complete a short or long rest before you can use it again.

trait.name: Closed Mind
trait.text: Colicoid brains have an unusual composition which gives them a natural defense against the Force. You have advantage on Wisdom and Charisma saving throws against force powers.

trait.name: Defensive Ball
trait.text: You are able to curl into a rolling ball for extra protection. When you take the Dash action while you aren't wielding a shield, you gain a bonus to AC equal to half your proficiency bonus (rounded up) until the start of your next turn.

trait.name: Natural Armor
trait.text: You are able to curl into a rolling ball for extra protection. When you take the Dash action while you aren't wielding a shield, you gain a bonus to AC equal to half your proficiency bonus (rounded up) until the start of your next turn.

trait.name: Stinger
trait.text: Your stinger is a natural weapon, which you can use to make unarmed strikes. If you hit with it, you deal kinetic damage equal to 1d4 + your Strength modifier.

trait.name: Languages
trait.text: You can speak, read, and write Galactic Basic and Colicoid. The Colicoid language uses sounds produced by the antennae and jointed legs of the colicoids, including humming sounds and clicks, which makes it difficult for other species to speak.

trait.name: Claws
trait.text:
Your claws are natural weapons, which you can use to make unarmed strikes. If you hit with them, you deal kinetic damage equal to 1d6 + your Strength modifier.
Source: Star Wars 5e v0.9.1 (Homebrew)

trait.name: Force Contention
trait.text: Due to their unique physiology, dashade hardiness allows them to overcome use of the Force. You have advantage on Strength and Constitution saving throws against force powers.

trait.name: Heat Dissipation
trait.text: Whenever you make a Dexterity (Stealth) check to avoid detection by electronic sensors and cameras, you are considered to have expertise in the Stealth skill.

trait.name: Menacing
trait.text: You gain proficiency in the Intimidation skill.

trait.name: Radiation Resistant
trait.text: Dashade are naturally able to resist radiation. You have resistance to necrotic damage.

trait.name: Language
trait.text: You can speak, read, and write Galactic Basic and Dashadi. Dashadi is characterized by its low pitch and elongated growls.

trait.name: Claws
trait.text:
Your claws are a natural weapon, which you can use to make unarmed strikes. If you hit with them, you deal kinetic damage equal to 1d4 + your Strength modifier. You can use your choice of your Strength or Dexterity modifier for the attack and damage rolls. You must use the same modifier for both rolls.
Source: Star Wars 5e v0.9.1 (Homebrew)

trait.name: Darkvision
trait.text: You have a keen eyesight, especially in the dark. You can see in dim light within 120 feet of you as if it were bright light, and in darkness as if it were dim light. You can't discern color in darkness, only shades of gray.

trait.name: Hidden Step
trait.text: As a bonus action, you can turn invisible until the start of your next turn or until you attack, make a damage roll, or force someone to make a saving throw. Once you've used this trait, you can't use it again until you finish a short or long rest.

trait.name: Miners
trait.text: You have proficiency in scavenging kits.

trait.name: Sunlight Sensitivity
trait.text: You have disadvantage on attack rolls and on Wisdom (Perception) checks that rely on sight when you, the target of your attack, or whatever you are trying to perceive is in direct sunlight.

trait.name: Sneaky
trait.text: You are proficient in the Stealth skill.

trait.name: Surprise Attack
trait.text: If you surprise a creature and hit it with an attack on your first turn in combat, the attack deals an extra 2d6 damage to it. You can use this trait only once per combat.

trait.name: Undersized
trait.text: Your small stature makes it hard for you to wield bigger weapons. You can't use heavy shields. Additionally, you can't use martial weapons with the two-handed property unless it also has the light property, and if a martial weapon has the versatile property, you can only wield it in two hands.

trait.name: Languages
trait.text: You can speak, read, and write Galactic Basic and Defel. Most defel refuse to speak Galactic Basic while on their home planet of Af'El unless they have a specific need for it.

trait.name: Physical Characteristics
trait.text:
Height 4'10" +2d8" Weight 120 lb. x (2d4) lb.
Source: Star Wars 5e v0.9.1 (Homebrew)

trait.name: Ability Score Increase
trait.text: Your Constitution score increases by 2, and your Charisma score increases by 1.

trait.name: Jungle Dweller
trait.text: Growing up in the jungles of Devaron has left an impact. You are proficient in Survival. Additionally, you don't treat jungle terrain as difficult terrain.

trait.name: Tech Resistance
trait.text: Devaronians have a history of using technology as a weapon. You have advantage on saving throws against tech powers.

trait.name: Two Livered
trait.text: Devaronians have two livers, which makes them adept at filtering toxins. You have advantage on saving throws against poison, and you have resistance against poison damage (explained in chapter 9).

trait.name: Languages
trait.text: You can speak, read, and write Galactic Basic and Devaronese. Devaronese is characterized by grunts and grumbles. It is rare to hear a Devaronian speak it any where other than their homeworld of Devaron.

Height 5'5" +2d12" Weight 130 lb. x (2d4) lb.

trait.name: Ability Score Increase
trait.text: Your Wisdom score increases by 2, and your Strength score increases by 1.

trait.name: Darkvision
trait.text: You can see in dim light within 60 feet of you as if it were bright light, and in darkness as if it were dim light. You can't discern color in darkness, only shades of gray.

trait.name: Way of the Warrior
trait.text: You have proficiency with light and medium armor as well as vibroblades and vibroswords.

trait.name: Telepathy
trait.text: You can communicate telepathically with creatures within 30 feet of you. You must share a language with the target in order to communicate in this way.

trait.name: Languages
trait.text: ou can speak, read, and write Galactic Basic and Draethos. Draethos is characterized by its flurry of cacophonous sighs and clicks.

Your Intelligence score increases by 2, and your Wisdom or Charisma score increases by 1.
Source: Star Wars 5e v0.9.1 (Homebrew)

trait.name: Type
trait.text: Your creature type is droid.

trait.name: Armor Integration
trait.text: You can not wear armor, but you can have the armor professionally integrated into your chassis. Over the course of a long rest, you can expend materials equal to half the cost of the armor in order to have it integrated. This work must be done by someone proficient with astrotech's tools. You must be proficient in armor in order to have it integrated.

trait.name: Droid Resistances
trait.text: You are resistant to necrotic, poison, and psychic damage, and are immune to poison and disease.

trait.name: Droid Vulnerabilities
trait.text: You are vulnerable to ion damage. Additionally, you have disadvantage on saving throws against effects that would deal ion or lightning damage.

trait.name: Droid Systems
trait.text: You do not need to eat or drink.

trait.name: Force Insensitive
trait.text: While droids can be manipulated by many force powers, they can not sense the Force. You can not use force powers or take levels in forcecasting classes.

trait.name: Maintenance Mode
trait.text: Rather than sleep, you enter an inactive state to perform routine maintenance for 4 hours each day. You have disadvantage on Wisdom (Perception) checks while performing maintenance.

trait.name: Rapid Reconstruction
trait.text: You are built with internal repair mechanisms. As a bonus action, you can choose to spend one of your Hit Dice to recover hit points.

trait.name: Languages
trait.text: You can speak, read, and write Galactic Basic and one language of your choice.

On a failure, the target becomes immune to this feature for one day. You can use this ability a number of times equal to your Wisdom modifier (a minimum of once). trait.name: Clone Characteristics
trait.text:
The basic Republic Clone is bred for obedience and military discipline.
Though often viewed as the "Flesh and blood" equivalent of Battle Droids, most Clones possess a limited capacity for individuality. They were bred for no other purpose than combat, but nevertheless they developed as individuals under the guidance of their Jedi officers. The Jedi's unique abilities and leadership prowess earned them the admiration and respect of the Clones who served under them, and as such allowed Clones to develop a more individual mindset.
Republic Clones are genetic replicas of the Human Species. Specifically, they are based off of the bounty hunter Jango Fett, and as a result they are almost indistinguishable from one another.
Homeworld: The vast majority of Republic Clones are created on Kamino by the Kaminoans.
Languages: Republic Clones all learn Basic.
Example Names: When a Republic Clone is created, they are assigned a two letter and four digit identification tag, although those that survive multiple deployments tend to take up a moniker to better identify themselves.
Adventurers: All Republic Clones received basic training in core military skills, such as weapons handling, marksmanship, drill, and other essentials. As such, the vast majority of Republic Clones become Soldiers, with a rare few becoming Scouts and Technicians.
Source: Star Wars 5e v0.9.1 (Homebrew)

trait.name: Ability Scores Aberration
trait.text: Republic Clones begin play with the following Ability Score array: Strength 15, Dexterity 13, Constitution 10, Intelligence 12, Wisdom 10, and Charisma 8. Additionally, a Republic Clone player can choose one Ability Score to increase by 2 at the time of Character Creation.

trait.name: Bonus Feat
trait.text: Republic Clones gain one bonus Feat at 1st level.

trait.name: Bonus Proficiency
trait.text:
Republic Clones are versatile and accomplished at many tasks. A Republic Clone character chooses one additional proficiency at 1st level.
The Skill must be chosen from the character's list of Class Skills.

trait.name: Echoes of The Original
trait.text:
Your mind isn't completely your own or, at least, it wasn't always yours. As you are a clone of another living being typically the life experiences of the original host have been suppressed or wiped. Do to the brain wash program of order 66, you experience echoes from another life.
Intrusive Echoes. Immediately after you make an attack roll, an ability check, or a saving throw and roll a 1 on the d20, your minds memories emerge and overtake your perceptions and experiences. You might see people around you as someone other than who they are, or you become disoriented by a double-experience of the world around you.
These echoes grant you knowledge, talents, or even languages you can't always explain, but they also intrude on your perceptions and beliefs unexpectedly. They will last for 1d12 rounds in combat or hours of provoked out of combat. Roll on or choose an option from the Echoes table to determine the nature of this Gift.
Additionally, you gain the traits that follow.
Echo Table: d6 | Echo 1 | My mind is with that of another clone elsewhere, perhaps on another world. 2 | I have lived many times before, my mind compiling experiences each time a clone from the same host dies creating an amalgam of thoughts and personality. 3 | My consciousness is an exact replica of the original being I believe I am he/she. 4 | I was physically and mentally merged with two separate body and minds. As such I am a unique combination. (Imperial or Sith experimentation) 5 | I share my body with an intangible, otherworldly mind, a non corporeal being. 6 | Time fractures around me, and I sometimes collide with my originals past or future.
Roll on the Intrusive Echoes table to determine the effect of these vivid memories and perceptions. Once one of effects occur, these intrusive echoes can't manifest again until you finish a short or long rest.
Intrusive Echoes Table: d6 | Effect 1 | You are charmed by a creature you can see (of the DM's choice) for 1 minute or until the creature damages you. 2 | You are frightened by a creature you can see (of the DM's choice) for 1 minute, or until the creature damages you. 3 | You perceive another time or place around you until the end of your next turn. During this time, you are blinded to your actual surroundings. 4 | You perceive a different time or place overlapping your surroundings. Your speed is halved until the end of your next turn. 5 | Memories and sensations overwhelm you. You are incapacitated until the start of your next turn. 6 | Your memory is one of triumph. You can reroll the ability check, attack roll, or saving throw that you just made. You must use the new roll.

trait.text: You can breathe air and water.

trait.name: Stealthy
trait.text: You are proficient in the Stealth skill.

trait.name: Mask of the Wild
trait.text: You can attempt to hide even when you are only lightly obscured by foliage, heavy rain, falling snow, mist, and other natural phenomena.

trait.name: Languages
trait.text: You can speak, read, and write Galactic Basic, Felucianese, and one more language of your choice. Felucianese is characterized by guttural, whisper-like vowels, interspersed with hard clicks.

trait.name: Ability Score Increase
trait.text:
Your Strength score increases by 2, and your Wisdom or Charisma score increases by 1.
Source: Star Wars 5e v0.9.1 (Homebrew)

trait.name: Aggressive
trait.text: As a bonus action, you can move up to your speed toward an enemy of your choice that you can see or hear. You must end this move closer to the enemy than you started.

trait.name: Cannabalize
trait.text: If you spend at least 1 minute devouring the corpse of a beast or humanoid, you gain temporary hit points equal to your Constitution modifier (minimum of one). Once you've used this feature, you must complete a short or long rest before you can use it again.

trait.name: Darkvision
trait.text: You have a keen eyesight, especially in the dark. You can see in dim light within 60 feet of you as if it were bright light, and in darkness as if it were dim light. You can't discern color in darkness, only shades of gray.

trait.name: Force Contention
trait.text: Due to their unique physiology, flesh raider hardiness allows them to overcome use of the Force. You have advantage on Strength and Constitution saving throws against force powers.

trait.name: Menacing
trait.text: You gain proficiency in the Intimidation skill.

trait.name: Hunters
trait.text: Whenever you make a Wisdom (Survival) check to hunt for food, you are considered to have expertise in the Survival skill.

trait.name: Languages
trait.text: You can speak, read, and write Galactic Basic and Rakata. Rakata is characterized by its deep tones and simplistic nature, using mainly consonants and long vowels. It's script seems to be a very ancient form of Galactic Basic.

trait.name: Physical Characteristics
trait.text:
Height 4'10" +2d8" Weight 150 lb. x (2d6) lb.
Source: Star Wars 5e v0.9.1 (Homebrew)

trait.name: Ability Score Increase
trait.text: Your Strength score increases by 2, and your Constitution score increases by 1.

trait.name: Gamorrean Toughness
trait.text: Your hit point maximum increases by 1, and it increases by 1 every time you gain a level. Additionally, you have advantage on Constitution saving throws.

trait.name: Gamorrean Weaponry
trait.text: You have proficiency with the vibroaxe, vibroclub, and vibrosword.

trait.name: Savage Attacks
trait.text: When you score a critical hit with a melee weapon attack, you can roll one of the weapon's damage dice one additional time and add it to the extra damage of the critical hit.

trait.name: Languages
trait.text: You can speak, read, and write Gamorrese. You can understand spoken and written Galactic Basic, but your vocal cords do not allow you to speak it. Gamorrese is characterized by its grunts and squeals, and its writing is a crude, pictographic style.

trait.name: Physical Characteristics
trait.text:
Height 4'1" +2d10" Weight 75 lb. x (2d4) lb.
Source: Star Wars 5e v0.9.1 (Homebrew)

trait.name: Ability Score Increase
trait.text: Your Constitution score increases by 2, and your Intelligence score increases by 1.

trait.name: Exoskeleton
trait.text: You have a thick exoskeleton. When you aren't wearing armor, your AC is 12 + your Dexterity modifier.

trait.name: Gand Resilience
trait.text: You have advantage on saving throws against poison, and you have resistance against poison damage (explained in chapter 9).

trait.name: Lungless
trait.text: Gand do not have lungs, and therefore do not need to breathe.

trait.name: Regenerative
trait.text: When you take damage, you can use your reaction and expend a Hit Die to regain health as long as the damage would not reduce your hit points to 0.

trait.name: Languages
trait.text: You can speak, read, and write Galactic Basic and Gand. The Gand language does not use pronouns as Gand refer to themselves in the third person, so often Gand who speak Galactic Basic are difficult to understand.

trait.name: Physical Characteristics
trait.text:
Height 5'5" +2d4" Weight 60 lb. x (2d4) lb..
Source: Star Wars 5e v0.9.1 (Homebrew)

trait.name: Ability Score Increase
trait.text: You Dexterity score increases by 2, and your Constitution or Intelligence score increases by 1.

trait.name: Crafter
trait.text: Geonosian culture promotes artisanry. You have proficiency in one tool of your choice.

trait.name: Exoskeleton
trait.text: You have a thick exoskeleton. When you aren't wearing armor, your AC is 12 + your Dexterity modifier.

trait.name: Flight
trait.text: You have a flying speed of 30 feet. To use this speed, you can't be wearing medium or heavy armor.

trait.name: Geonosian Weaponry
trait.text: You have proficiency in simple blasters.

trait.name: Languages
trait.text: You can speak, read, and write Galactic Basic and Geonosian. The Geonosian language conists of click consonants through use of a Geonosians' dual mandibles. This makes it difficult for other species to learn to speak it.

trait.name: Physical Characteristics
trait.text:
Height 5'5" +2d8" Weight 105 lb. x2d4 lb.
Source: Star Wars 5e v0.9.1 (Homebrew)

trait.name: Ability Score Increase
trait.text: Your Intelligence score increases by 2, and your Constitution score increases by 1.

trait.name: Hardened Exterior
trait.text: You have a tough, bony exterior. When you aren't wearing armor, your AC is 13 + your Dexterity modifier.

trait.name: Mathematical Savants
trait.text: Whenever you make an Intelligence (Technology) check involving mathematics, you are considered to have expertise in the Technology skill.

trait.name: Stargazer
trait.text: You have proficiency in Piloting* (Religion) and Technology* (Arcana).

trait.name: Vacuum Sealed
trait.text: You can survive for one day within the vacuum of space. You still require oxygen to breathe. You have resistance to cold damage.

trait.name: Languages
trait.text: You can speak, read, and write Galactic Basic and Givin. Givin is characterized by its use of mathematical jargon and symbols, making it nigh incomprehensible to the less mathematically inclined.

trait.name: Physical Characteristics
trait.text:
Height 5'5" +2d10" Weight 120 lb. x (2d4) lb.
Source: Star Wars 5e v0.9.1 (Homebrew)

trait.name: Ability Score Increase
trait.text: Your Wisdom score increases by 2, and one other ability score of your choice increase by 1.

trait.name: Energy Sensors
trait.text: Gotals perceive the environment around them through use of electromagnetic sensors held in their cranial horns. You have blindsight out to 30 feet. If another trait would grant you blindsight, the range is increased by half as many feet.

trait.name: Hunter
trait.text: You are proficient in Survival.

trait.name: Natural Empathy
trait.text: Gotal's electromagnetic sensors allow them to sense the emotions in those around them. You have advantage on Wisdom (Insight) checks to determine emotions against humanoids and beasts within 10 feet of you.

trait.name: Languages
trait.text: You can speak, read, and write Galactic Basic and Antarian. The Antarian language is characterized by growls and clicking noises at various volumes.

trait.name: Physical Characteristics
trait.text:
Height 4'10" +2d10" Weight 115 lb. x (2d4) lb.
Source: Star Wars 5e v0.9.1 (Homebrew)

trait.name: Ability Score Increase
trait.text: Your Constitution score increases by 2, and your Wisdom score increases by 1.

trait.name: Slow Metabolism
trait.text: You are able to go a number of days without food equal to 3 + twice your Constitution modifier before suffering exhaustion.

trait.name: Keen Sight
trait.text: Through use of infrared vision, you have advantage on Wisdom (Perception) checks that rely on sight.

trait.name: Reader of Hearts
trait.text: Through identifying subtle variations in a target's body heat, the Gran are able to better understand their emotions and intentions. You are proficient in the Insight skill.

trait.name: Toughness
trait.text: Your hit point maximum increases by 1, and it increases by 1 every time you gain a level.

trait.name: Languages
trait.text: You can speak, read, and write Galactic Basic and Gran. It is rare to hear Gran spoken on any world other than Kinyen.

trait.name: Physical Characteristics
trait.text:
Height 5'5" +2d10" Weight 115 lb. x (2d4) lb.
Source: Star Wars 5e v0.9.1 (Homebrew)

trait.name: Ability Score Increase
trait.text: Your Dexterity score increases by 2, and your Strength score increases by 1.

trait.name: Amphibious
trait.text: You can breathe air and water.

trait.name: Martial Proficiency
trait.text: You have proficiency with light and medium armor as well as the vibrospear and vibropike.

trait.name: Darkvision
trait.text: You can see in dim light within 60 feet of you as if it were bright light, and in darkness as if it were dim light. You can't discern color in darkness, only shades of gray.

trait.name: Strong-Legged
trait.text: When you make a long jump, you can cover a number of feet up to twice your Strength score. When you make a high jump, you can leap a number of feet up into the air equal to 3 + twice your Strength modifier.

trait.name: Swim
trait.text: You have a swimming speed of 30 feet.

trait.name: Languages
trait.text: You can speak, read, and write Galactic Basic and Gungan. When speaking Galactic Basic, you often have trouble with word tenses and infinitives; this usually has a comical effect.

trait.name: Size
trait.text:
Half-humans stand and weigh around the average of the two species' height and weight. Regardless of your position in that range, your size is the size of your non-human half.
Source: Star Wars 5e v0.9.1 (Homebrew)

trait.name: Speed
trait.text: Your base walking speed is that of your non-human half.

trait.name: Ability Score Increase
trait.text: Half-humans gain the ability score increases of their non-human half, but they can choose any ability score for one of the options, instead of the given option. Half-humans can not increase the same ability score twice during character creation using this feature.

trait.name: Defiant
trait.text: Half-humans are known to be stubborn and often refuse to give up, even against the worst odds. When you or a creature you can see that can see and understand you makes an ability check, attack roll, or saving throw, you can roll a d4 and add it to their roll (no action required). You can use this before or after the roll, but before the GM determines the roll's outcome. Once you've used this feature, you must complete a short or long rest before you can use it again.

trait.name: Additional Trait
trait.text:
Half-humans also gain the special traits from their non-human half, except for those trait (s) mentioned in the Half-Human table below.
(There was too much to put here, you can find the table at Star Wars 5e.com/characters/species/Half-human )

trait.name: Languages
trait.text: You can speak, read, and write Galactic Basic, regardless of whether or not the non-human half can speak it, and the language (s) associated with your non-human half.

trait.name: Physical Characteristics
trait.text:
Height 5'5" +2d8" Weight 150 lbs. x (2d4) lbs.
Source: Star Wars 5e v0.9.1 (Homebrew)

trait.name: Ability Score Increase
trait.text: Your Strength, Intelligence, and Constitution scores increase by 1.

trait.name: Darkvision
trait.text: You can see in dim light within 60 feet of you as if it were bright light, and in darkness as if it were dim light. You can't discern color in darkness, only shades of gray.

trait.name: Bite
trait.text: Your fangs are a natural weapon, which you can use to make unarmed strikes. If you hit with them, you deal 1d4 + your Strength modifier kinetic damage.

trait.name: Six-Armed
trait.text: Harch have six arms which they can use independently of one another. You can only gain the benefit of items held by two of your arms at any given time, and once per round you can switch which arms you are benefiting from (no action required).

trait.name: Spider Climb
trait.text: You have a climbing speed of 30 feet. You have advantage on Strength saving throws and Strength (Athletics) checks that involve climbing, and while climbing you always have two hands free.

trait.name: Venomous Fangs
trait.text: As a bonus action, you can make a special attack with your bite. If the attack hits, it deals its normal damage, and the target must make a Constitution saving throw (DC = 8 + your proficiency bonus + your Constitution modifier). On a failed save, the target is poisoned until the end of its next turn, and you can't use this feature again until you complete a short or long rest.

trait.name: Languages
trait.text: You can speak, read, and write Galactic Basic and Harchese. Harchese is discernible from other insectoid languages by a noticeable emphasis on consonants, especially the "ch" sound.

trait.name: Physical Characteristics
trait.text:
Height 6' +2d12" Weight 200 lbs x (2d8) lbs.
Source: Star Wars 5e v0.9.1 (Homebrew)

trait.name: Ability Score Increase
trait.text: Your Strength score increases by 2, and your Intelligence score increases by 1.

trait.name: Hold Breath
trait.text: You can hold your breath for up to 1 hour at a time.

trait.name: Powerful Build
trait.text: You count as one size larger when determining your carrying capacity and the weight you can push, drag, or lift.

trait.name: Swim
trait.text: You have a swimming speed of 30 feet.

trait.name: Technician
trait.text: You are proficient in the Technology* (Arcana) skill.

trait.name: Toughness
trait.text: Your hit point maximum increases by 1, and it increases by 1 every time you gain a level.

trait.name: Languages
trait.text: You can speak, read, and write Galactic Basic and Herglese. Herglese has a clear and commanding cadence, drawing the attention of those who hear it.

trait.name: Highly Adaptable
trait.text:
Humans gain one bonus Feat at 1st level. To represent their highly adaptable nature.
Source: Star Wars 5e v0.9.1 (Homebrew)

trait.name: Language - Galactic Basic
trait.text: Galactic Basic, is the common trade language, and the language used by all humans. It is also the official language of the empire. As such some individuals go a whole lifetime without having to learn another language.

trait.name: Bonus Trained Skill
trait.text: Humans are versatile and accomplished at many tasks. A Human character chooses one additional Trained Skill at 1st level. The Skill must be chosen from the character's list of Class Skills.

trait.name: Human Info
trait.text:
Humans dominate the Core Worlds and can be found in virtually every corner of the galaxy. They are the ancestors of early spacefaring pioneers, conquerors, traders, travelers, and refugees. Humans have always been people on the move. As a result, they can be found on almost every inhabited planet. As a Species, Humans are physically, culturally, and politically diverse. Hardy or fine, light-skinned or dark, Humans remain one of the most dominant Species throughout all eras of play.
Human Characteristics
Personality: Human personality runs the gamut of possibilities, though members of this Species tend to be highly adaptable, tenacious, and willing to keep striving no matter the odds. They are flexible and ambitious, diverse in their tastes, morals, customs, and habits.
Average Height/Weight: A typical Human male stands at 5', 10" tall and weighs 165 lbs, while a typical Human female stands at 5', 2" tall and weighs 121 lbs.
Homeworlds: Various, including Coruscant, Corellia, Naboo, Tatooine, and Alderaan.
Example Names: Anakin, Arani, Bail, Ben, Biggs, Boba, Corran, Dack, Dan, Galak, Garm, Han, Jango, Jodo, Lando, Leia, Luke, Mace, Mara, Obi-Wan, Owen, Padm, Qui-Gon, Sia-Lan, Rann, Talon, Vor'en, Wedge, Winter.
Adventurers: Humans aren't afraid to try anything, and Human adventurers are the most audacious, daring, and ambitious members of an audacious, daring, and ambitious Species. A Human can earn glory by amassing power, wealth, and fame. More than any other Species, Humans champion causes rather than territories or groups.

trait.name: Physical Characteristics
trait.text:
Height 4'8" +2d10" Weight 110 lb. x (2d4) lb..
Source: Star Wars 5e v0.9.1 (Homebrew)

trait.name: Ability Score Increase
trait.text: One ability score of your choice increases by 2, and two different abilities of your choice increase by 1. Alternatively, four ability scores of of your choice each increase by 1.

trait.name: Defiant
trait.text: Humans are known to be stubborn and often refuse to give up, even against the worst odds. You can add a d4 to a skill check or saving throw, after rolling but before you know the outcome. You must then finish a short or long rest before you can use this feature again.

trait.name: Proficiency
trait.text: You gain proficiency in one skill, one tool, and one weapon of your choice.

trait.name: Languages
trait.text: You can speak, read, and write Galactic Basic and one extra language of your choice. Humans typically learn the languages of other peoples they deal with, including obscure dialects. They are fond of sprinkling their speech with words borrowed from other tongues: trandoshan curses, twi'lek musical expressions, chiss military phrases, and so on.

trait.name: Ability Score Increase
trait.text:
Your Constitution score increases by 2, and two other ability scores of your choice increase by 1.
Source: Star Wars 5e v0.9.1 (Homebrew)

trait.name: Closed Mind
trait.text: Hutt brains have an unusual composition which made them resistant to influence from the Force. You have advantage on Wisdom and Charisma saving throws against force powers.

trait.name: Natural Resistance
trait.text: You have advantage on saving throws against poison, and you have resistance against poison damage (explained in chapter 9).

trait.name: Powerful Build
trait.text: Your carrying capacity and the weight you can push, drag, or lift doubles. If it would already double, it instead triples.

trait.name: Prehensile Tail
trait.text: Your carrying capacity and the weight you can push, drag, or lift doubles. If it would already double, it instead triples.

trait.name: Shrewd Demeanor
trait.text: You have proficiency in two Intelligence, Wisdom, or Charisma skills of your choice.

trait.name: Slow and Lethargic
trait.text: Hutts are slow and generally incapable of moving quickly. You have disadvantage on Dexterity saving throws, and when determining your bonus to AC from your Dexterity, you can't add more than +3.

trait.name: Wealthy
trait.text: During character creation, you start with additional credits equal to your level x your proficiency bonus x 1,000 cr.

trait.name: Languages
trait.text: You can speak, read, and write Galactic Basic and Huttese. Hutts rarely speak Galactic Basic, even though they are perfectly able; if the person with whom they are speaking doesn't understand Huttese, they are more likely to use an interpretor than deign to speak the language of lesser species.

trait.name: Ability Score Increase

trait.name: Precognition
trait.text: You can see brief fragments of the future, that allow you to turn failures into successes. When you roll a 1 on an attack roll, ability check, or saving throw, you can reroll the die and must use the new roll.

trait.name: Telepathy
trait.text: You can communicate telepathically with creatures within 30 feet of you. You must share a language with the target in order to communicate in this way.

trait.name: Sonic Scream
trait.text: You can use your action to violently expell air in a 15-foot cone. When you do so, each creature in the area of the exhalation must make a Wisdom saving throw. The DC for this saving throw equals 8 + your proficiency bonus + your Constitution modifier. A creature takes 2d6 sonic damage on a failed save, and half as much damage on a successful one. The damage increases to 4d6 at 5th level, 6d6 at 11th level, and 8d6 at 17th level. This ability has no effect on constructs.

Once you use this trait, you can't use it again until you finish a short or long rest.

trait.text: You have proficiency in Sleight of Hand.

trait.text: You have proficiency with tinker's tools. You can use these and spend 1 hour and 100 cr worth of materials to construct a Tiny Device (AC 5, 1 hp). You can take the Use an Object action to have your device cause one of the following effects: create a small explosion, create a repeating loud noise for 1 minute, create smoke for 1 minute, cause a small electrical fire.

trait.text: You can speak, read, and write Jawaese. You can understand spoken and written Galactic Basic, but your vocal cords do not allow you to speak it. Jawaese blends quickly spoken, semi-meaningless syllables with scents to be understood.

trait.name: Unarmed Combatant

trait.name: Darkvision
trait.text: Your natural evolution allows you to see what others do not in dim and dark conditions. You can see in dim light within 60 feet of you as if it were bright light, and in darkness as if it were dim light. You can't discern color in darkness, only shades of gray.

trait.name: Foreign Biology
trait.text: You cannot breathe oxygen. The kel dors have created a breathing apparatus to negate the negative effects of living in an oxygen rich environment, but if your mask is removed while you are in such an environment, you lose consciousness.

trait.name: Life in the Void
trait.text: You can survive for one hour within the vacuum of space. You have resistance to Necrotic damage.

trait.name: Telepathy
trait.text: You can communicate telepathically with creatures within 30 feet of you. You must share a language with the target in order to communicate in this way.

trait.name: Languages
trait.text: You can speak, read, and write Galactic Basic and Kel Dor.

trait.name: Physical Characteristics
trait.text:
Height 4'9" +2d10" Weight 110 lb. x (2d4) lb.
Source: Star Wars 5e v0.9.1 (Homebrew)

trait.name: Ability Score Increase
trait.text: Your Intelligence score increases by 2, and your Constitution score increases by 1.

trait.name: Four-Armed
trait.text: Killiks have four arms which they can use independently of one another. You can only gain the benefit of items held by two of your arms at any given time, and once per round you can switch which arms you are benefiting from (no action required).

trait.name: Hardened Carapace
trait.text: When you aren't wearing armor, your AC is 13 + your Dexterity modifier.

trait.name: Strong-Legged
trait.text: When you make a long jump, you can cover a number of feet up to twice your Strength score. When you make a high jump, you can leap a number of feet up into the air equal to 3 + twice your Strength modifier.

trait.name: Telepathy
trait.text: You can communicate telepathically with creatures within 30 feet of you. You must share a language with the target in order to communicate in this way.

trait.name: Languages
trait.text: You can speak, read, and write Killik. You can understand spoken and written Galactic Basic, but your vocal cords do not allow you to speak it.

trait.name: Enforcer
trait.text:
You are proficient in the Intimidation skill. When you take the Help action to give an ally advantage on an Intimidation check, they gain a bonus to the roll equal to your proficiency bonus.
Source: Star Wars 5e v0.9.1 (Homebrew)

trait.name: Toughness
trait.text: Your hit point maximum increases by 1, and it increases by 1 every time you gain a level.

trait.name: Weapon Training
trait.text: Klatooinians are trained to fight from a young age. You have proficiency in two martial vibroweapons of your choice.

trait.name: Wisdom of the Elders
trait.text: You are proficient in the Lore skill.

trait.name: Languages
trait.text: You can speak, read, and write Galactic Basic, Klatooinian, and Huttese. Klatooinian is a gutteral, barking language, with many loanwords adopted from Huttese over the centuries.

trait.text:

trait.name: Ability Score Increase
trait.text: Your Dexterity score increases by 2, and your Intelligence score increases by 1.

trait.name: Art Obsession
trait.text: Whenever you make an ability check related to the acquisition or location of art or valuables, you are considered proficient in the check. If you would already be proficient, you instead have expertise.

trait.name: Darkvision
trait.text: You have a keen eyesight, especially in the dark. You can see in dim light within 120 feet of you as if it were bright light, and in darkness as if it were dim light. You can't discern color in darkness, only shades of gray.

trait.name: Deft Hand
trait.text: You have proficiency in one of the following skills: Deception, Sleight of Hand, or Stealth.

trait.name: Keen Smell

trait.name: Slicer

trait.name: Sunlight Sensitivity
trait.text: You wear protective eyewear, and if your goggles are removed while you are in an area of bright light, you have disadvantage on attack rolls and Wisdom (Perception) checks that rely on sight.

trait.name: Languages
trait.text: You can speak, read, and write Galactic Basic and Kubazian. Kubazian is comprised of a unique series of whirring, nasally syllables, causing Kubaz to have a high-pitched accent when speaking other languages.

trait.text:

trait.text: Your Charisma score increases by 2, and your Dexterity score increases by 1.

trait.text: As an action on your turn, you can cower pathetically to distract nearby foes. Once you use this trait, you can't use it again until you finish a short or long rest.

trait.name: Hide
trait.text: You have a thick hide. When you aren't wearing armor, your AC is 12 + your Dexterity modifier. Additionally, your thick hide is naturally adapted to cold climates, as described in chapter 5 of the Dungeon Master's Guide.

trait.name: Mask of the Wild
trait.text: You can attempt to hide even when you are only lightly obscured by foliage, heavy rain, falling snow, mist, and other natural phenomena.

trait.name: Nimble Agility
trait.text: Your reflexes and agility allow you to move with a burst of speed. When you move on your turn in combat, you can double your speed until the end of the tum. Once you use this trait, you can't use it again until you move 0 feet on one of your turns.

trait.name: Stealthy
trait.text: You are proficient in the Stealth skill.

trait.name: Languages
trait.text: You can speak, read, and write Galactic Basic and Kushiban. Kushiban has a bubbly, joyful tone to it.

trait.name: Force Sensitive

trait.text: You have advantage on Wisdom (Perception) checks that rely on hearing or sight.

trait.name: Powerful Build
trait.text: You count as one size larger when determining your carrying capacity and the weight you can push, drag, or lift.

trait.name: Rolling Agility
trait.text: As a lurmen, you can run on all fours, or curl into a ball, to move quickly along the ground. When you move on your turn in combat, you can double your speed until the end of the tum. Once you use this trait, you can't use it again until you move 0 feet on one of your turns.

trait.name: Treeclimber
trait.text: You have a climbing speed of 25 feet. You have advantage on Strength saving throws and Strength (Athletics) checks that involve climbing.

trait.name: Undersized
trait.text: Your small stature makes it hard for you to wield bigger weapons. You can't use heavy shields. Additionally, you can't use martial weapons with the two-handed property unless it also has the light property, and if a martial weapon has the versatile property, you can only wield it in two hands.

trait.name: Languages
trait.text: You can speak, read, and write Galactic Basic and Lurmese. Lurmese is a name collectively given to the various tribal languages spoken by the lurmen people. While each language is distinct, shared phrases allow translation between dialects.

trait.text: Pa'lowick are best known for the energy they can bring to a singing performance. Whenever you make a Charisma (Performance) check involving singing, you are considered to have expertise in the Performance skill.

trait.name: Snout
trait.text: You have supreme control over your snout and can use it to manipulate objects as well as your hands. Additionally, your snout is a natural weapon, which you can use to make unarmed strikes. If you hit with it, you deal 1d4 + your Strength modifier kinetic damage.

trait.name: Sonic Scream
trait.text: As an action, you can violently expel air in a 15-foot cone. When you do so, each creature in the area of the exhalation must make a Wisdom saving throw (DC = 8 + your proficiency bonus + your Constitution modifier). A creature takes 2d6 sonic damage on a failed save, and half as much damage on a successful one. The damage increases to 4d6 at 5th level, 6d6 at 11th level, and 8d6 at 17th level. This ability has no effect on constructs. You can use this feature a number of times equal to your Constitution modifier (a minimum of once). You regain one use of this feature when you finish a long rest.
