trait.text: You have proficiency in Intimidation.

trait.name: Surprise Attack
trait.text: If you surprise a creature and hit it with an attack on your first turn in combat, the attack deals an extra 2d6 damage to it. You can use this trait only once per combat.

trait.name: Unarmed Combatant
trait.text: Your unarmed strikes deal 1d4 kinetic damage. You can use your choice of your Strength or Dexterity modifier for the attack and damage rolls. You must use the same modifier for both rolls.

trait.name: Languages
trait.text: You can speak, read, and write Galactic Basic and Rattataki. Rattataki is known for have an inordinate amount of curses.

trait.name: Flight
trait.text:
You have a flying speed of 30 feet. To use this speed, you can't be wearing medium or heavy armor.
Source: Star Wars 5e v0.9.1 (Homebrew)

trait.name: Keen Hearing and Sight
trait.text: You have advantage on Wisdom (Perception) checks that rely on hearing or sight.

trait.name: Mimicry
trait.text: You can mimic sounds you have heard, including voices. A creature that hears the sounds you make can tell they are imitations with a successful Wisdom (Insight) check opposed by your Charisma (Deception) check.

trait.name: Languages
trait.text: You can speak, read, and write Galactic Basic and Rishii. Rishii's clicks, trills, and whistles are difficult for outsiders to learn without the aid of a protocol droid, and so Rishii often feel comfortable speaking to eachother in the language in front of others.

trait.name: Adept Climbers
trait.text:
You have a climbing speed of 30 feet.
Source: Star Wars 5e v0.9.1 (Homebrew)

trait.name: Darkvision
trait.text: You can see in dim light within 60 feet of you as if it were bright light, and in darkness as if it were dim light. You can't discern color in darkness, only shades of gray.

trait.name: Hunter
trait.text: You are proficient in Survival and Stealth.

trait.name: Keen Hearing and Smell
trait.text: You have advantage on Wisdom (Perception) checks that involve hearing or smell.

trait.name: Languages
trait.text: You can speak, read, and write Galactic Basic and Rodese. Rodians can communicate with eachother using pheromones. Force-sensitives can detect this communication, though they can't understand it.

trait.name: Ability Score Increase
trait.text:
Your Intelligence or Charisma score increases by 2, and your Dexterity score increases by 1.
Source: Star Wars 5e v0.9.1 (Homebrew)

trait.name: Con Artist
trait.text: You have proficiency in one gaming set of your choice.

trait.name: Darkvision
trait.text: You can see in dim light within 60 feet of you as if it were bright light, and in darkness as if it were dim light. You can't discern color in darkness, only shades of gray.

trait.name: Divination
trait.text: Whether through mystical divination or sheer luck, you can turn failures into successes. When you roll a 1 on the d20 for an attack roll, ability check, or saving throw, you can reroll the die and must use the new roll.

trait.name: Eternal Nomads
trait.text: You have proficiency in Lore or Survival (your choice).

trait.name: Musical
trait.text: You have proficiency in Performance and one musical instrument of your choice.

trait.name: Prehensile Tail
trait.text: You have supreme control over your tail and can use it to manipulate objects as well as your hands.

trait.name: Language
trait.text: You can speak, read, and write Galactic Basic and Ryn. Ryn uses tones and inflections and is easily described as melodious by anyone who hears it. You can communicate with droids and other ryn without using words through the use of your beak.

trait.name: Amphibious
trait.text:
You can breathe air and water.
Source: Star Wars 5e v0.9.1 (Homebrew)

trait.name: Claws
trait.text: Your claws are a natural weapon, which you can use to make unarmed strikes. If you hit with them, you deal kinetic damage equal to 1d4 + your Strength modifier. You can use your choice of your Strength or Dexterity modifier for the attack and damage rolls. You must use the same modifier for both rolls. Additionally, as a bonus action, you can perform a special claw attack. On a hit, the target suffers the attack's normal effects, and it must make a Constitution saving throw (DC = 8 + your proficiency bonus + your Constitution modifier). On a failed save, the target is poisoned until the end of its next turn, and you can't use this feature again until you complete a short or long rest.

trait.name: Gift of the Progenitor
trait.text: You know the temporary boost at-will tech power. When you reach 3rd level, you learn and can cast the kolto pack tech power once per day. When you reach 5th level, you learn and can cast the kolto cloud tech power once per day. Your techcasting ability is Intelligence. You do not require use of a wristpad for these powers.

trait.name: Swim
trait.text: You have a swimming speed of 30 feet.

trait.name: Languages
trait.text: You can speak, read, and write Galactic Basic and Selkatha. Selkatha has a very moist and gurgling tone to it.

trait.name: Darkvision
trait.text:
You can see in dim light within 60 feet of you as if it were bright light, and in darkness as if it were dim light. You can't discern color in darkness, only shades of gray.
Source: Star Wars 5e v0.9.1 (Homebrew)

trait.name: Forced March
trait.text: Shistavanen are able to maintain a fast pace longer than other species. Shistavanen have advantage on Constitution saving throws made to avoid Exhaustion due to prolongued travel, as described in Chapter 8.

trait.name: Keen Hearing and Smell
trait.text: You have advantage on Wisdom (Perception) checks that involve hearing or smell.

trait.name: Regenerative
trait.text: When you take damage, you can use your reaction and expend a Hit Die to regain hit points as long as the damage would not reduce your hit points to 0.

trait.name: Tooth and Nail
trait.text: Your fangs and claws are natural weapons, which you can use to make unarmed strikes. If you hit with them, you deal kinetic damage equal to 1d6 + your Strength modifier.

trait.name: Languages
trait.text: You can speak, read, and write Galactic Basic and Shistavanen. The Shistavanen language is characterized by its barks and growls.

trait.name: Ability Score Increase
trait.text:
Your Charisma score increases by 2, and your Strength or Dexterity score increases by 1.
Source: Star Wars 5e v0.9.1 (Homebrew)

trait.name: Darkvision
trait.text: Your vision can easily cut through darkness. You can see in dim light within 60 feet of you as if it were bright light, and in darkness as if it were dim light. You can't discern color in darkness, only shades of gray.

trait.name: Force-Sensitive
trait.text: You know the denounce at-will force power. When you reach 3rd level, you learn and can cast the curse force power once per long rest. When you reach 5th level, you learn and can cast the darkness force power once per long rest. Your forcecasting ability is Charisma for these powers.

trait.name: Menacing
trait.text: You gain proficiency in the Intimidation skill.

trait.name: Sadistic
trait.text: You have proficiency with saberwhips, vibrowhips, and nets.

trait.name: Languages
trait.text: You can speak, read, and write Galactic Basic and Sith. Sith is an agglutinative language, in which words or even phrases were made up of linears sequences of distinct meaningful units.

trait.name: Bite
trait.text:
Your sharp teeth are a natural weapon, which you can use to make unarmed strikes. If you hit with it, you deal kinetic damage equal to 1d4 + your Strength modifier.
Source: Star Wars 5e v0.9.1 (Homebrew)

trait.name: Business Savvy
trait.text: A common trait of all Squibs is their desire and love of haggling. Squibs believe a deal is done when both sides believe they got the better of the other. Whenever you make a Charisma (Persuasion) check involving haggling you are considered to have expertise in the Persuasion skill.

trait.name: Flexible Cheeks
trait.text: Squibs have flexible cheeks in which they can store small goods. You can store up to two items that weigh a combined total of no more than 2 lb. in your cheeks, and you have advantage on Dexterity (Sleight of Hand) checks made to conceal them.

trait.name: Hide
trait.text: Your thick hide is naturally adapted to cold climates, as described in chapter 5 of the Dungeon Master's Guide.

trait.name: Keen Smell
trait.text: You have advantage on Wisdom (Perception) checks that rely on smell.

trait.name: Sensitive Fur
trait.text: Squibs' fur is exceptionally sensitive to physical details. You have advantage on Intelligence (Investigation) checks that rely on touch.

trait.name: Undersized
trait.text: Your small stature makes it hard for you to wield bigger weapons. You can't use heavy shields. Additionally, you can't use martial weapons with the two-handed property unless it also has the light property, and if a martial weapon has the versatile property, you can only wield it in two hands.

trait.name: Languages
trait.text: You can speak, read, and write Galactic Basic and Squibbian. The Squibbian language originated as a secret form of communication for Squibs to convey information without being understood.

trait.name: Type
trait.text:
Your creature type is both beast and humanoid.
Source: Star Wars 5e v0.9.1 (Homebrew)

trait.name: Force-Insensitive
trait.text: While Ssi-ruuk can be manipulated by many force powers, they can not sense the Force. You can not use force powers or take levels in forcecasting classes.

trait.name: Hunter
trait.text: You are proficient in Survival.

trait.name: Keen Smell
trait.text: You have advantage on Wisdom (Perception) checks that rely on smell.

trait.name: Natural Empathy
trait.text: Ssi-ruuk have scent-tongues that let them read the emotions of individuals. You have advantage on Wisdom (Insight) checks to determine emotions against humanoids and beasts within 10 feet of you.

trait.name: Sunlight Sensitivity
trait.text: You have disadvantage on attack rolls and on Wisdom (Perception) checks that rely on sight when you, the target of your attack, or whatever you are trying to perceive is in direct sunlight.

trait.name: Thick Skin
trait.text: You have tough, scaly skin and prefer not to wear clothes. While you are unarmored or wearing light armor, your AC is 13 + your Dexterity modifier.

trait.name: Tooth and Nail
trait.text: Your fangs and claws are natural weapons, which you can use to make unarmed strikes. If you hit with them, you deal kinetic damage equal to 1d6 + your Strength modifier.

trait.name: Languages
trait.text: You can speak, read, and write Galactic Basic and Ssi-ruuvi. Ssi-ruuvi is a language of musical whistles, honks and clicks, and is nigh impossible for humans and similar species to speak.

trait.name: Darkvision
trait.text:
You can see in dim light within 60 feet of you as if it were bright light, and in darkness as if it were dim light. You can't discern color in darkness, only shades of gray.
Source: Star Wars 5e v0.9.1 (Homebrew)

trait.name: Keen Hearing
trait.text: You have advantage on Wisdom (Perception) checks that rely on hearing.

trait.name: Mercantile
trait.text: Whenever you make a Charisma (Persuasion) check related to conducting business, you are considered to have expertise in the Persuasion skill.

trait.name: Pilot
trait.text: You have proficiency in Piloting.

trait.name: Languages
trait.text: You can speak, read, and write Galactic Basic, Sullestese, and one more language of your choice. Sullestese is characterized as a robust language in business, and as such is commonly learned by professional merchants.

trait.name: Darkvision
trait.text:
Your vision can easily cut through darkness. You can see in dim light within 60 feet of you as if it were bright light, and in darkness as if it were dim light. You can't discern color in darkness, only shades of gray.
Source: Star Wars 5e v0.9.1 (Homebrew)

trait.name: Hide
trait.text: You have a thick hide. While you are unarmored or wearing light armor, your AC is 12 + your Dexterity modifier. Additionally, your thick hide is naturally adapted to cold climates, as described in chapter 5 of the Dungeon Master's Guide.

trait.name: Long-Limbed
trait.text: When you make a melee attack on your turn, your reach for it is 5 feet greater than normal.

trait.name: Languages
trait.text: You can speak, read, and write Talzzi. You can understand spoken and written Galactic Basic, but your vocal cords do not allow you to speak it. Talzzi is characterized by its high-pitched chirps and buzzes.

trait.name: Chameleon Skin
trait.text:
Your scales are translucent, allowing your color-shifting skin to help you blend into your surroundings. You have proficiency in the Stealth skill. Additionally, you can attempt to hide even when you are only lightly obscured by foliage, heavy rain, falling snow, mist, and other natural phenomena.
Source: Star Wars 5e v0.9.1 (Homebrew)

trait.name: Jungle Dweller
trait.text: Growing up in the jungles of Cularin has left an impact. You don't treat jungle terrain as difficult terrain.

trait.name: Naturalist
trait.text: You have proficiency in the Nature skill.

trait.name: Sa'tosin Sense
trait.text: Tarasins have short spines called sa'tosin that allow them to sense the use of the Force. You are constantly under the effects of the force power sense force, though the power does not require concentration for you.

trait.name: Languages
trait.text: You can speak, read, and write Galactic Basic and Tarasinese. You can communicate non-verbally with other tarasins through use of a complex system of skin color changes.

trait.name: Aggressive
trait.text:
As a bonus action, you can move up to your speed toward an enemy of your choice that you can see or hear. You must end this move closer to the enemy than you started.
Source: Star Wars 5e v0.9.1 (Homebrew)

trait.name: Arm Blades
trait.text: Your retractable dewclaws are natural weapons, which you can use to make unarmed strikes. If you hit with them, you deal kinetic damage equal to 1d6 + your Strength modifier.

trait.name: Toughness
trait.text: Your hit point maximum increases by 1, and it increases by 1 every time you gain a level.

trait.name: Mechanical Memory
trait.text: Whenever you make an Intelligence (Technology) check related to memorizing or duplicating mechanical readouts, you are considered to have expertise in the Technology skill.

trait.name: Languages
trait.text: You can speak, read, and write Galactic Basic and Yevethan. Yevetha are able to speak other languages, but their isolationist nature makes them tend to reject the languages of other species. Only rarely would a Yevethan speak Galactic Basic, as this would often decrease their social standing.

trait.name: Claws
trait.text:
Your claws are a natural weapon, which you can use to make unarmed strikes. If you hit with them, you deal kinetic damage equal to 1d4 + your Strength modifier.
Source: Star Wars 5e v0.9.1 (Homebrew)

trait.name: Cultured
trait.text: You have proficiency in the Lore skill.

trait.name: Four-Armed
trait.text: Thisspiasians have four arms which they can use independently of one another. You can only gain the benefit of items held by two of your arms at any given time, and once per round you can switch which arms you are benefiting from (no action required).

trait.name: Inscrutable
trait.text: Your calm demeanor and control make you hard to read. Wisdom (Insight) checks made against you have disadvantage, and you have advantage on any saving throw against an effect that would read your thoughts.

trait.name: Prehensile Tail
trait.text: You have supreme control over your tail and can use it to manipulate objects as well as your hands.

trait.name: Trance
trait.text: Thisspiasians only require 2 hours of sleep a day. After resting in this way, you gain the same benefit that a human does from 8 hours of sleep.

trait.name: Languages
trait.text: You can speak, read, and write Galactic Basic and Thisspiasian. Thisspiasian is a complex language characterized by its interlocking sentences and heavy use of sibilants.

trait.name: Ability Score Increase
trait.text:
Your Strength score increases by 2, and your Dexterity or Constitution score increases by 1.
Source: Star Wars 5e v0.9.1 (Homebrew)

trait.name: Claws
trait.text: Togorians have retractable claws. You are proficient with your claws, which deal 1d6 kinetic damage on a hit.

trait.name: Savage Attacks
trait.text: When you score a critical hit with a melee weapon attack, you can roll one of the weapon's damage dice one additional time and add it to the extra damage of the critical hit.

trait.name: Stealthy Hunter
trait.text: You have proficiency in the Survival and Stealth skills.

trait.name: Toughness
trait.text: Your hit point maximum increases by 1, and it increases by 1 every time you gain a level.

trait.name: Languages
trait.text: You can speak, read, and write Galactic Basic and Togorese. Togorese is characterized by its deep, resonating growls.

trait.name: Ability Score Increase
trait.text:
Your Wisdom score increases by 2, and your Strength or Dexterity score increases by 1.
Source: Star Wars 5e v0.9.1 (Homebrew)

trait.name: Darkvision
trait.text: Your vision can easily cut through darkness. You can see in dim light within 60 feet of you as if it were bright light, and in darkness as if it were dim light. You can't discern color in darkness, only shades of gray.

trait.name: Montral Reception
trait.text: You have tremorsense out to 30 feet. You can detect and pinpoint the origin of vibrations within a specific radius, provided that monster and the source of the vibrations are in contact with the same ground or substance. Tremorsense can't be used to detect flying or incorporeal creatures.

trait.name: Wild Hunters
trait.text: You have proficiency with the Survival skill.

trait.name: Languages
trait.text: You can speak, read, and write Galactic Basic and Togruti. Togruti is an ornate language characterized by trills and long vowel sounds which are modified by subtle tremors in the togruta's head-tails. This language is heavily influenced by Basic, but also incorporates some native idioms, which caused Basic-speaking togruta to use seemingly strange expressions.

trait.name: Business Savvy
trait.text:
A common trait of all Toydarians is their shrewd business sense and their ability to haggle any deal. A loyal and proud people, these traits could be off-putting to outsiders, as many Toydarians in the galaxy were seen as crooks or slimy businessmen, but this was not always the case. Whenever you make a Charisma (Persuasion) check involving haggling you are considered to have expertise in the Persuasion skill.
Source: Star Wars 5e v0.9.1 (Homebrew)

trait.name: Closed Mind
trait.text: Toydarian brains have an unusual composition which made them resistant to influence from the Force. You have advantage on Wisdom and Charisma saving throws against force powers.

trait.name: Flight
trait.text: You have a flying speed of 25 feet. To use this speed, you can't be wearing medium or heavy armor.

trait.name: Shrewd Demeanor
trait.text: You have proficiency in two Intelligence, Wisdom, or Charisma skills of your choice.

trait.name: Undersized
trait.text: Your small stature makes it hard for you to wield bigger weapons. You can't use heavy shields. Additionally, you can't use martial weapons with the two-handed property unless it also has the light property, and if a martial weapon has the versatile property, you can only wield it in two hands.

trait.name: Languages
trait.text: You can speak, read, and write Galactic Basic, Huttese, and Toydarian.

trait.name: Darkvision
trait.text:
Your vision can easily cut through darkness. You can see in dim light within 60 feet of you as if it were bright light, and in darkness as if it were dim light. You can't discern color in darkness, only shades of gray.
Source: Star Wars 5e v0.9.1 (Homebrew)

trait.name: Hold Breath
trait.text: You can hold your breath for up to 15 minutes at a time.

trait.name: Regenerative
trait.text: When you take damage, you can use your reaction and expend a Hit Die to regain hit points as long as the damage would not reduce your hit points to 0.

trait.name: Saving Face
trait.text: Trandoshans are careful not to show weakness in front of their allies, for fear of losing status. If you miss with an attack roll or fail an ability check or a saving throw, you can gain a bonus to the roll equal to the number of allies you can see within 30 feet of you (maximum bonus of +5). Once you use this trait, you can't use it again until you finish a short or long rest.

trait.name: Languages
trait.text: You can speak, read, and write Galactic Basic and Dosh. Dosh is characterized by its harsh grunts, hisses and growls, and its written form that used alphabetic glyphs.

trait.name: Ability Score Increase
trait.text:
Your Constitution score increases by 2, and your Strength or Charisma score increases by 1.
Source: Star Wars 5e v0.9.1 (Homebrew)

trait.name: Aggressive
trait.text: As a bonus action, you can move up to your speed toward an enemy of your choice that you can see or hear. You must end this move closer to the enemy than you started.

trait.name: Animal Handler
trait.text: You are proficient in Animal Handling.

trait.name: Intimidating Roar
trait.text: Once per day, you can cast the fear force power. Charisma is your forcecasting ability for this power.

trait.name: Survivors of the Sands
trait.text: You are proficient in Survival. Additionally, you don't treat desert terrain as difficult terrain. Lastly, you are naturally adapted to hot climates, as described in chapter 5 of the Dungeon Master's Guide.

trait.name: Tusken Weaponry
trait.text: You have proficiency with the slugthrower and vibromace.

trait.name: Languages
trait.text: You can speak, read, and write Galactic Basic and Tusken. Tusken is a guttural language characterized by its barks, growls, and roars. While Tuskens typically understand Galactic Basic, it is rare to hear them speak anything but Tusken.

trait.name: Darkvision
trait.text:
Your vision can easily cut through darkness. You can see in dim light within 60 feet of you as if it were bright light, and in darkness as if it were dim light. You can't discern color in darkness, only shades of gray.
Source: Star Wars 5e v0.9.1 (Homebrew)

trait.name: Elegant Dancer
trait.text: You have proficiency with the Performance skill.

trait.name: Natural Antitoxins
trait.text: You have advantage on saving throws against poison and disease, and you have resistance against poison damage (explained in Chapter 9).

trait.name: Unarmed Combatant
trait.text: Your unarmed strikes deal 1d4 kinetic damage. You can use your choice of your Strength or Dexterity modifier for the attack and damage rolls. You must use the same modifier for both rolls.

trait.name: Languages
trait.text: You can speak, read, and write Galactic Basic and Twi'leki. You can communicate non-verbally with other twi'leks through a complex language of subtle head-tail motions.

trait.name: Bite
trait.text:
Your tusks are a natural weapon, which you can use to make unarmed strikes. If you hit with them, you deal kinetic damage equal to 1d6 + your Strength modifier.
Source: Star Wars 5e v0.9.1 (Homebrew)

trait.name: Crafters
trait.text: You have proficiency in one tool of your choice.

trait.name: Darkvision
trait.text: You can see in dim light within 60 feet of you as if it were bright light, and in darkness as if it were dim light. You can't discern color in darkness, only shades of gray.

trait.name: Industrial Hazards
trait.text: You have resistance to acid damage.

trait.name: Tech Dabbler
trait.text: You know the mending at-will tech power. When you reach 3rd level, you learn and can cast the analyze tech power once per day. When you reach 5th level, you learn and can cast the overheat tech power once per day. Your techcasting ability is Intelligence. You do not require use of a wristpad for these powers.

trait.name: Tinker
trait.text: You have proficiency with tinker's implements. You can use these and spend 1 hour and 100 cr worth of materials to construct a Tiny Device (AC 5, 1 hp). You can take the Use an Object action to have your device cause one of the following effects: create a small explosion, create a repeating loud noise for 1 minute, create smoke for 1 minute, cause harmless tremors for 1 minute. You can maintain a number of these devices up to your proficiency bonus at once, and a device stops functioning after 24 hours away from you. You can dismantle the device to reclaim the materials used to create it.

trait.name: Undersized
trait.text: Your small stature makes it hard for you to wield bigger weapons. You can't use heavy shields. Additionally, you can't use martial weapons with the two-handed property unless it also has the light property, and if a martial weapon has the versatile property, you can only wield it in two hands.

trait.name: Languages
trait.text: You can speak, read, and write Galactic Basic and Ugnaught. The Ugnaught language is composed of grunts, squeals, and chatters, and is difficult for other species to learn.

trait.name: Ability Score Increase
trait.text:
Your Intelligence score increases by 2, and your Charisma or Wisdom score increases by 1.
Source: Star Wars 5e v0.9.1 (Homebrew)

trait.name: Superior Darkvision
trait.text: You've lived most of your life without direct sunlight. You can see in dim light within 120 feet of you as if it were bright light, and in darkness as if it were dim light. You can't discern color in darkness, only shades of gray.

trait.name: Umbaran Specialization
trait.text: You have proficiency in one of the following skills: Insight, Technology, Deception, or Perception.

trait.name: Tech Dabbler
trait.text: You know the ward at-will tech power. When you reach 3rd level, you learn and can cast the analyze tech power once per day. When you reach 5th level, you can also cast the infiltrate tech power once per day. Intelligence is your techcasting ability for these powers. You do not require use of a wristpad for these powers.

trait.name: Shadow People
trait.text: You can attempt to hide even when you are only lightly obscured by dim light.

trait.name: Sunlight Sensitivity
trait.text: You have disadvantage on attack rolls and on Wisdom (Perception) checks that rely on sight when you, the target of your attack, or whatever you are trying to perceive is in direct sunlight.

trait.name: Languages
trait.text: You can speak, read, and write Galactic Basic and Umbaran. Umbaran is characterized by its blending of technical jargon with informal language. It is rarely spoken off Umbara.

trait.name: Crafters
trait.text:
You have proficiency in one tool of your choice.
Source: Star Wars 5e v0.9.1 (Homebrew)

trait.name: Hardened Carapace
trait.text: While you are unarmored or wearing light armor, your AC is 13 + your Dexterity modifier.

trait.name: Tympanic Antennae
trait.text: You have tremorsense out to 30 feet. You can detect and pinpoint the origin of vibrations within that radius, provided that monster and the source of the vibrations are in contact with the same ground or substance. Tremorsense can't be used to detect flying or incorporeal creatures.

trait.name: Languages
trait.text: You can speak, read, and write Verpine. You can understand spoken and written Galactic Basic, but your vocal cords do not allow you to speak it. You can communicate with other Verpine at distances of up to a mile using your antennae.

trait.name: Darkvision
trait.text:
You can see in dim light within 60 feet of you as if it were bright light, and in darkness as if it were dim light. You can't discern color in darkness, only shades of grey.
Source: Star Wars 5e v0.9.1 (Homebrew)

trait.name: Precognition
trait.text: You see brief visions of the future, that allow you to turn failures into successes. When you roll a 1 on an attack roll, ability check, or saving throw, you can reroll the die and must use the new roll.

trait.name: Mystic Healing
trait.text: You have proficiency in Medicine.

trait.name: Voss Weapon Training
trait.text: You have proficiency with the blaster rifle and techblade.

trait.name: Inscrutable
trait.text: Your calm demeanor and control make you hard to read. Wisdom (Insight) checks made against you have disadvantage, and you have advantage on any saving throw against an effect that would read your thoughts.

trait.name: Languages
trait.text: You can speak, read, and write Galactic Basic and Voss. The Voss language is characterized by it's mystic-sounding word pairings.

trait.name: Amphibious
trait.text:
You can breathe air and water.
Source: Star Wars 5e v0.9.1 (Homebrew)

trait.name: Athletic
trait.text: You have proficiency in the Athletics skill.

trait.name: Darkvision
trait.text: Accustomed to life underwater, you have superior vision in low light conditions. You can see in dim light within 60 feet of you as if it were bright light, and in darkness as if it were dim light. You can't discern color in darkness, only shades of gray.

trait.name: Head Crest
trait.text: Your head crest is a natural weapon, which you can use to make unarmed strikes. If you hit with it, you deal 1d6 + your Strength modifier kinetic damage.

trait.name: Swim
trait.text: You have a swimming speed of 30 feet.

trait.name: Languages
trait.text: You can speak, read, and write Galactic Basic and Semblan. Semblan has a very melodic feel and often evokes images of waterfalls to those who don't understand its meanings.

trait.name: Charming
trait.text:
You have proficiency in Deception or Persuasion.
Source: Star Wars 5e v0.9.1 (Homebrew)

trait.name: Darkvision
trait.text: Your vision can easily cut through darkness. You can see in dim light within 60 feet of you as if it were bright light, and in darkness as if it were dim light. You can't discern color in darkness, only shades of gray.

trait.name: Keen Smell
trait.text: You have advantage on Wisdom (Perception) checks that rely on smell.

trait.name: Tanned
trait.text: You have tough, leathery skin. While you are unarmored or wearing light armor, your AC is 13 + your Dexterity modifier. Additionally, your thick hide is naturally adapted to hot climates, as described in chapter 5 of the Dungeon Master's Guide.

trait.name: Languages
trait.text: You can speak, read, and write Galactic Basic and Sriluurian. You can communicate with other Weequay within 30 feet without speaking through use of pheromones. Force attuned individuals can detect the communication but can't understand it.

trait.name: Claws
trait.text:
Wookiees have retractable claws. You are proficient with your claws, which deal 1d4 kinetic damage on a hit.
Source: Star Wars 5e v0.9.1 (Homebrew)

trait.name: Darkvision
trait.text: Your vision can easily cut through darkness. You can see in dim light within 60 feet of you as if it were bright light, and in darkness as if it were dim light. You can't discern color in darkness, only shades of gray.

trait.name: Hide
trait.text: You have a thick hide. When you aren't wearing armor, your AC is 13 + your Dexterity modifier. Additionally, your thick hide is naturally adapted to cold climates, as described in chapter 5 of the Dungeon Master's Guide.

trait.name: Powerful Build
trait.text: You count as one size larger when determining your carrying capacity and the weight you can push, drag, or lift.

trait.name: Treeclimber
trait.text: You have a climbing speed of 30 feet. You have advantage on Strength saving throws and Strength (Athletics) checks that involve climbing.

trait.name: Languages
trait.text: You can speak, read, and write Shyriiwook. You can understand spoken and written Galactic Basic, but your vocal cords do not allow you to speak it.

trait.name: Aggressive
trait.text:
As a bonus action, you can move up to your speed toward an enemy of your choice that you can see or hear. You must end this move closer to the enemy than you started.
Source: Star Wars 5e v0.9.1 (Homebrew)

trait.name: Arm Blades
trait.text: Your retractable dewclaws are natural weapons, which you can use to make unarmed strikes. If you hit with them, you deal kinetic damage equal to 1d6 + your Strength modifier.

trait.name: Toughness
trait.text: Your hit point maximum increases by 1, and it increases by 1 every time you gain a level.

trait.name: Mechanical Memory
trait.text: Whenever you make an Intelligence (Technology) check related to memorizing or duplicating mechanical readouts, you are considered to have expertise in the Technology skill.

trait.name: Languages
trait.text: You can speak, read, and write Galactic Basic and Yevethan. Yevetha are able to speak other languages, but their isolationist nature makes them tend to reject the languages of other species. Only rarely would a Yevethan speak Galactic Basic, as this would often decrease their social standing.

trait.name: Ability Score Increase
trait.text:
Your Constitution score increases by 2, and your Strength or Dexterity score increases by 1.
Source: Star Wars 5e v0.9.1 (Homebrew)

trait.name: Coercive
trait.text: You have proficiency with Persuasion or Intimidation (your choice).

trait.name: Crafters
trait.text: You have proficiency with with one set of artisan's implements of your choice.

trait.name: Darkvision
trait.text: Your vision can easily cut through darkness. You can see in dim light within 60 feet of you as if it were bright light, and in darkness as if it were dim light. You can't discern color in darkness, only shades of gray.

trait.name: Second Heart
trait.text: When you are reduced to 0 hit points but not killed outright, you can drop to 1 hit point instead. You can't use this feature again until you finish a long rest.

trait.name: Unarmed Combatant
trait.text: Your unarmed strikes deal 1d4 kinetic damage. You can use your choice of your Strength or Dexterity modifier for the attack and damage rolls. You must use the same modifier for both rolls.

trait.name: Languages
trait.text: You can speak, read, and write Galactic Basic and Zabraki.

trait.name: Charismatic
trait.text:
You have proficiency with Deception or Persuasion (your choice).
Source: Star Wars 5e v0.9.1 (Homebrew)

trait.name: Enthralling Pheromones
trait.text: You can use your pheromones to influence individuals of both sexes. Whenever you roll a 1 on a Charisma (Persuasion) check, you can reroll the die and must use the new roll. Additionally, once per short or long rest, you can treat a d20 roll of 9 or lower on a Charisma check as a 10. This feature has no effect on droids or constructs.

trait.name: Natural Empathy
trait.text: Zeltron's limited telepathy allow them to sense mood shifts in those around them. You have advantage on Wisdom (Insight) checks to determine emotions against humanoids and beasts within 10 feet of you.

trait.name: Two-Livered
trait.text: Zeltron have two livers, which makes them adept at filtering toxins. You have advantage on saving throws against poison, and you have resistance against poison damage (explained in chapter 9).

trait.name: Languages
trait.text: You can speak, read, and write Galactic Basic and one language of your choice.

trait.name: Acrobatic
trait.text:
You have proficiency in Acrobatics.
Source: Star Wars 5e v0.9.1 (Homebrew)

trait.name: Claws
trait.text: Your unarmed strikes deal 1d4 kinetic damage. You can use your choice of your Strength or Dexterity modifier for the attack and damage rolls. You must use the same modifier for both rolls.

trait.name: Darkvision
trait.text: You have a cat's keen senses, especially in the dark. You can see in dim light within 60 feet of you as if it were bright light, and in darkness as if it were dim light. You can't discern color in darkness, only shades of gray.

trait.name: Notorious Slavers
trait.text: Whenever you make an ability check related to the buying, selling, or controlling of slaves, you are considered proficient in the check. If you would already be proficient, you instead have expertise.

trait.name: Reputation for Cruelty
trait.text: You are proficient in Intimidation, as well as the saberwhip and vibrowhip.

trait.name: Languages
trait.text: You can speak, read, and write Galactic Basic and Zygerrian. Zygerrian is characterized by its subtle growls and purrs.
